briefTitle: Investigation and Modulation of the Mu-Opioid Mechanisms in Migraine (in Vivo)
officialTitle: Investigation and Modulation of the Mu-Opioid Mechanisms in Migraine (in Vivo)

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Episodic migraine (ICHD-3-beta) for at least 6 months, with at least one attack per month and less than 15 attacks per month
* No intake of opiate medication for the past six months
* No overuse of analgesic medication, defined as regular intake on ≥15 days per month for more than 3 months
* Willing to limit the introduction of new treatments for headache management

Exclusion Criteria:

* Presence of any other systemic or chronic pain disorder
* History or current evidence of a psychotic disorder (e.g. schizophrenia) or substance abuse; bipolar or severe major depression, as evidenced by Beck Depression score of ≥ 30
* History of neurological disorder (e.g. epilepsy, stroke, neuropathy, neuropathic pain)
* Prior use of tDCS
* Current use of opioid pain medications

primary.description: Moderate to severe headache is defined by the pain over 3 in an Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) ranging from 0 to 10 between end of treatment and one month follow-up.
primary.timeFrame: End of treatment - over 1 month follow-up

primary.description: Number of participants who showed a 50% reduction of days with moderate-to-severe headache compared to baseline.
primary.timeFrame: End of treatment - over 1 month follow-up

secondary.measure: Change in Pain Intensity Level Measured by the Visual Analog Scale in Migraineurs (Active or Sham)
secondary.description: Visual Analog Scale measures pain on a 0 to 10 scale, where 0 is "no pain" and 10 is "worst possible pain"
secondary.timeFrame: Approximately 45 days (Screening Visit [Original Baseline] to Follow Up #2 [28-days post-HD-tDCS treatment])

secondary.description:
Percentage of participants having moderate-to-severe headache between end of treatment and one month follow-up.

Defined as a response greater than 3 on the (0-10) NRS scale
secondary.timeFrame: End of treatment - over 1 month follow-up

secondary.description: Percentage of participants who used rescue medication between end of treatment and one month follow-up
secondary.timeFrame: End of treatment - over 1 month follow-up

secondary.measure: Change in Mu-opioid Receptor Non-displaceable Binding Potential (BPND) in the Brains of Migraineurs During Sustained Thermal Pain Threshold Stress Challenge Subsequent to Treatment by HD-tDCS (Active or Sham).
secondary.description:
Mu-opioid receptor BPND at PET #2 will be subtracted from mu-opioid receptor BPND at PET #1.

PET #1 occurs during the week before HD-tDCS treatment begins. PET #2 occurs during the week after the final HD-tDCS treatment is completed.
secondary.timeFrame: Time between PET #1 and PET #2 is typically 21 days (minimum 17 days; maximum 42 days).

secondary.measure: Change in Mu-opioid Receptor Non-displaceable Binding Potential (BPND) in the Brains of Migraineurs at Rest Subsequent to Treatment by HD-tDCS (Active or Sham).
secondary.description:
Mu-opioid receptor BPND at PET #2 will be subtracted from mu-opioid receptor BPND at PET #1.

PET #1 occurs during the week before HD-tDCS treatment begins. PET #2 occurs during the week after the final HD-tDCS treatment is completed.
secondary.timeFrame: Time between PET #1 and PET #2 is typically 21 days (minimum 17 days; maximum 42 days).
